titleStmt.title: Occation'd by ye 08. Bisps 08. in Ireland
Endeavouring to get an Act to divide
the Church Livings but ye 08. Bill was
Rejected by ye 08: House of Commons.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Old Latimer preaching did fairly describe
A Bishop who rul'd all yẹ rest of his Tribe.
And who was this B──p? & where did he dwell,
Why truly tis Satan──Archbishop of Hell;
And he was a Primate; & he wore a Mitre,
Surrounded wtḥ Iewels of Sulphur & Nitre.
How truly this B──p, our B──p, resembles!
But he ?overhis has ye: Odds, who believes, & who trembles,
Cou'd you see his grim Face, for a Pound to a penny
You'd swear it must be ye: Baboon of Kil────
Poor Satan will think ye: Comparison odious,
I wish I could find him out one more Commodious
But this I am sure ye: most Rev'rend old Dragon
Has got on ye: Bench many ──·──·──Suffrigan.
And many believe he presides there Jncog.
To give them by turnes an Invincible Iog.Our Bisops puff'd up wtḥ wealth & wth: Pride,
To Hell on yẹ Backs of yẹ Clergy would ride
They mounted, and labour'd wth: whip and wth Spur.
In vain, for ye Divel a Parson wou'd Stir.
So yẹ Commons unhorsd them & this was their do
On their Crosiers to ride, like a Witch on a Bro
Tho' they Gallop so fast, on ye: Road yu: may find em.
And have left us but Three of ye: 20: behind 'em.
Lord B──ps good Grace: Ld C──y──and Lḍ H──·──d,
Jn spight of yẹ Divel would still be untoward.
They came of good Blood, & could not endure.
Their former Acquaintance. should beg at their Door.
When Christ was betray'd to Pilate yẹ Praetor,
Jn a Douzen Apostles, but one prou'd a Traitor,
One Traitor alone, & faithfull Eleven,
But W────can afford you Six Traitors in Seven.
What a Clutter wth: Clippings, Dividings & Cleavings
And yẹ Clergy forsooth, must take up with their Leavings
Jf makeing Divisions was all their Intent,
We thank them, they've done it, but not as they meant
And so may such ──·────for ever divide
That no honest Heathen may be on their Side.
How should we rejoyce, if like Iudas yẹ first
Those Splitters of Parsons in sunder should burst
Now hear an Allusion────a Mitre you know
Js divided above, but United below.
Jf this you consider our Emblem is right,
The ────divide, but ye: Clergy Vnite.
Shou'd yẹ bottom be split our B──ps would dread
That yẹ Mitre would never stick fast to their Head.
And yet they have learnt yẹ chief Art of a Sovereign
As Machieval taught 'em: divide & ye Govern.
But Courage my Lḍ tho'. it cannot be said,
That one Cloven Tongue ever sat on yṛ Head.
J'll hold you a Groat, & I wish I cou'd see it,
Jf your Stockings were off, yụ could shew Cloven Feet.But hold Cry'd ye: B──p: & give us fair Play,
Before you condemn us, hear what we can say.
What truer Affection can ever be shewn
Than saving your Souls, by Damning our own
And have we not practis'd all Methods to gain you,
Wtḥ yẹ Tyth of yẹ Tyth of yẹ Tyths to maintain you
Provided a Fund for building your Spittles
You are only to live Four Years wth:out Victuals.
Content, my good Ldṣ but let us change Hands,
First take you our Tyths, & give us your Landhole:
So God bless ye: Church, & Three of our Mitrholes,
And God Blesse yẹ Commons for Biting ye: Biters.803-570Y
